com.xorprogramming.logging

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xorprogramming.logging.Logger

  • public final class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that manages logging to output. It uses a LoggingPolicy to determine which logging types actually get logged. It also notifies LoggerListeners when anything is logged regardless of the policy. This can be used for a central error handling, for example.

    Note that this class can be accessed concurrently. Also, when a thread logs a message, the LoggerListener.onLog method is called by that thread. Thus, in a multithreaded environment utilizing the Logger, a LoggerListener.onLog may require synchronization.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Steven Roberts
    See Also:
    LoggingPolicy, LoggerListener

    • Method Detail

      • setLoggingPolicy

        public static void setLoggingPolicy(LoggingPolicy newPolicy)
        Sets a new logging policy.
        Parameters:
        newPolicy - The new policy. If null, the policy is set to LoggingPolicy.NO_LOGGING

      • addLoggerListener

        public void addLoggerListener(LoggerListener listener)
        Adds a LoggerListener to be notified of logging events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The LoggerListener to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the listener is null

      • removeLoggerListener

        public void removeLoggerListener(LoggerListener listener)
        Removes the LoggerListener from the list of listeners. The listener will no longer be notified of logging events
        Parameters:
        listener - The LoggerListener to remove

      • log

        public static java.lang.String log(LoggingType type,
                   java.lang.String tag,
                   java.lang.String message)
        Logs a message to output with the given tag.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of message being logged
        tag - Used to identify the source of a log message. It usually identifies the class or activity where the log call occurs.
        message - The message to log
        Returns:
        The message

      • logf

        public static java.lang.String logf(LoggingType type,
                    java.lang.String tag,
                    java.lang.String messageFormat,
                    java.lang.Object... args)
        Logs a formatted message to output with the given tag.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of message being logged
        tag - Used to identify the source of a log message. It usually identifies the class or activity where the log call occurs.
        messageFormat - The format string (see Formatter.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...))
        args - The list of arguments passed to the formatter. If there are more arguments than required, additional arguments are ignored.
        Returns:
        The message

      • log

        public static <T extends java.lang.Throwable> T log(LoggingType type,

                                    T throwable)
        Logs a Throwable to output with LOG_TAG as the tag.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of message being logged
        tag - Used to identify the source of a log message. It usually identifies the class or activity where the log call occurs.
        throwable - The exception or error being logged
        Returns:
